title: French-Israeli relations go even colder as Gaza bombardment continues
summary: Israel's ambassador to Paris was summoned after gunfire from Israeli soldiers disrupted a group of foreign diplomats' visit to Jenin. The incident, in which no one was injured, comes amid heightened tensions between the two countries linked to the war in Gaza.

title: Trump administration revokes Harvard's right to enroll foreign students
summary: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem accused the university of harboring 'anti-American, pro-terrorist agitators,' and said its current international students must transfer to other schools or leave the US.

title: Israel's foreign minister blames Europe for the murders of Israeli embassy staffers
summary: Israel's foreign minister Gideon Saar blamed European criticism of his country's stepped-up Gaza offensive, claiming 'a direct line connecting anti-Semitic and anti-Israeli incitement to this murder': 'This incitement is also done by leaders and officials of many countries and international organizations, especially from Europe.'

title: Between hope and doubt, the Russian opposition in exile questions Trump-Putin negotiations
summary: A few dozen Kremlin opponents attended an anti-war conference organized in Brussels at the initiative of former oligarch Mikhail Khodorkovsky, who has become one of the main figures of Russian dissent abroad.

title: In Italy, the populist stunts of a Neapolitan TikTok star
summary: Influencer Rita De Crescenzo has established herself as a spokesperson for the working-class neighborhoods of the southern city of Naples. Using insults and threats, she is now considering entering politics.

title: Composer Alexandre Desplat at Cannes: 'People picture me in LA with a pink Lamborghini'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the French artist reflected on his time at the festival, where he gave a master class in addition to having two of his film scores featured in the main competition.

title: Trump, Ramaphosa agreed to strengthen trade, South Africa says
summary: The closed White House talks on Wednesday were preceded by a tense meeting, broadcast live, where Trump ambushed South African President Ramaphosa by playing a video that he claimed proved genocide is being committed against white people in South Africa. However, the US visit was deemed 'successful' by Romaphosa's office.

title: Netanyahu names new security chief, defying attorney general
summary: Following Thursday's announcement, the attorney general released a statement saying that the Israeli prime minister was acting 'contrary to legal guidance.' Netanyahu's move to appoint Major General David Zini to replace domestic security chief Ronen Bar was 'improper and unlawful,' the Israeli Supreme Court said.

title: US says Sudan used chemical weapons, imposes sanctions
summary: The State Department said it notified Congress on Thursday of its determination on the use of chemical weapons, triggering sanctions after 15 days. The sanctions include restrictions on US exports and financing to Sudan's government

title: 'Lilo & Stitch': Disney's pleasant surprise
summary: The live-action adaptation of the 2002 animated film, the story of a little girl who becomes very attached to a large extraterrestrial plush toy,  manages to rise above an excess of digital effects.

title: French election authorities scrutinize Jordan Bardella's 2024 European campaign funding
summary: Documents from the National Commission for Campaign Accounts reveal that the far-right candidate borrowed over €4 million from individuals. Some of these loans potentially contravene electoral law.

title: Trump and cryptocurrency: Serious suspicions of conflicts of interest
summary: While US President Donald Trump has pursued crypto-friendly policies, his family has launched many projects in the sector. For example, he will attend a 'gala' for $TRUMP token holders, held in Washington on Thursday.

title: Muslim Brotherhood's influence in France: What the controversial report reveals
summary: The document presented on Wednesday, but leaked to the press the previous day, proved more measured than the speeches that accompanied its release. It mainly identifies a political risk linked to the birth of 'municipal Islamism.'

title: Trump's plan for 'Golden Dome' defense system sparks concern and skepticism
summary: The US president announced he wants to allocate an initial $25 billion to develop this missile defense shield. However, the program, still in its early stages, would require deploying weapons systems in space.

title: French Open 2025: What to know before the draw
summary: The Roland Garros draw, which is taking place on Thursday, will provide a clearer picture of the contenders' chances for victory. For French fans, attention will be focused on who is drawn against Arthur Fils, the country's main hope in the tournament.

title: France seeks new rules to narrow the gender pay gap
summary: In order to comply with a European Union directive, the French government began consultations with labor unions and employers' federations on Wednesday, May 21.

title: Macron tells Xi their nations' companies 'must enjoy fair competition'
summary: President Xi urged China and France to 'strengthen solidarity and cooperation' and told his French counterpart that he was ready to work 'hand in hand with Europe.'

title: Turkey faces limits to its balancing act in diplomacy
summary: While Recep Tayyip Erdogan's pursuit of a multipolar world may be understandable at a time when major powers are proving less and less reliable, his transactional diplomacy has failed to advance any of the country's most pressing national interests.

title: 'Two years ago, a tenant spent a night in the garbage room': Elevator breakdowns, a nightmare for people with disabilities
summary: A bill was adopted in January by the Assemblée Nationale to reduce repair times and require spare parts stocks, even if it means increasing maintenance contract costs.

title: Promotions in major French supermarket chains often target foods that are too fatty, too sweet or too salty
summary: According to a survey conducted by seven advocacy groups in February and March, marketing campaigns overwhelmingly promoted foods that should be consumed less, with only 12% highlighting products recommended for a healthy diet, such as fruit, vegetables and legumes.

title: Record floods devastate eastern Australia
summary: The storms have dumped more than six months' worth of rain over three days, smashing flood-height records in some areas. 50,000 people are still stranded.

title: Chiquita announces layoffs in the thousands of 'all' striking Panama banana workers
summary: Chiquita Panama said the strike has cost it 'at least $75 million' in losses and caused 'irreversible damage' due to the workers' 'total abandonment' of the banana plantations.

title: Suspect charged with murder after Israeli embassy staff shot in Washington
summary: Two Israeli embassy staffers, identified as Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Lynn Milgrim by the Israeli foreign ministry, were shot dead late May 21, outside a Jewish museum in Washington by a gunman who shouted 'free Palestine,' authorities said.

title: AI race: US-China chip war heats up
summary: Despite easing tensions over tariffs, Washington has tightened regulations on the use of Chinese semiconductors, prompting Chinese retaliation.

title: Iran, US to hold new round of nuclear talks in Rome
summary: Since returning to office, Trump has revived his 'maximum pressure' campaign on Iran, which wants a new deal that would ease sanctions that have battered its economy.

title: France's Caroline Garcia announces retirement from tennis
summary: The former world number four said she has 'a few tournaments left' before she calls it quits. The first is the French Open, which starts on Sunday.

title: Harvard reeling after Trump administration ultimatum on foreign students
summary: The oldest and most prestigious university in the US has until Sunday to provide the documents required to regain its authorization to welcome foreign students. University leadership has condemned the move as 'unlawful.'

title: NGOs file legal action against Paris Air Show for showcasing Israeli companies
summary: A coalition of advocacy groups has filed two legal complaints seeking to prevent the Paris Air Show from taking place this year after it announced it will host Israeli companies as well as firms supplying weapons to wars in Ukraine and Sudan.

title: Trump's Gulf outreach sidelines Israel's influence in the Middle East
summary: In recent weeks, Benjamin Netanyahu has found himself caught off guard by the decisions of Israel's US ally. While the Israeli government remained entrenched in its hardline stances on numerous issues, the White House's attention shifted elsewhere.

title: Nuclear threat looms over conflict between India and Pakistan
summary: The use of nuclear weapons, possessed by both enemy states, casts a shadow over the recent conflict between India and Pakistan. While India's 'no first use' nuclear doctrine is well known, Pakistan's position remains much more ambiguous.

title: Why is Telegram founder Pavel Durov accusing France of interfering in Romania?
summary: While currently under investigation by French courts, Pavel Durov has claimed that the French foreign intelligence agency asked him to censor 'conservative voices in Romania,' without providing any evidence.

title: Trump threatens 50% EU tariff from June 1
summary: Stock markets in Europe and the United States all plummeted on Friday after the US president announced that trade talks 'are going nowhere' and was recommending 'a straight 50% Tariff on the European Union, starting on June 1.'

title: Russia, Ukraine begin biggest ever prisoner swap
summary: 'The first stage of the '1,000-for-1,000' exchange agreement has been carried out,' Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said in a post on X on Friday.

title: Trial of child abuser Le Scouarnec: Prosecution seeks maximum sentence of 20 years' imprisonment
summary: Joël Le Scouarnec, 74, went on trial in February 2025 accused of 111 rapes and 189 sexual assaults at a dozen hospitals in western France.

title: Republicans grant Trump political victory by passing his One Big Beautiful Bill Act in the House
summary: This sweeping bill, awaiting approval by the Senate, covers a wide range of spending, from tax policy to funding for mass deportations and funds allocated to the Pentagon. To get it passed, the US president put intense pressure on lawmakers in his own party.

title: Gaza: Many journalists' associations urge evacuation of Palestinian colleagues working for French outlets
summary: According to Brown University in the United States, the number of journalists killed in Gaza over the past 18 months exceeds the total number who died during both World Wars.

title: Cannes 2025: Director Saeed Roustaee says, 'in Iran, all filmmakers are under surveillance'
summary: In competition with his new feature film, 'Woman and Child,' the Iranian filmmaker responds to accusations of compromising with the regime, in an interview with Le Monde.
